comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This needs a little clarification - the "Mr Lang" in the title was Mr George Lang, Dr John Dunmore Lang's brother, who died in 1825 and was buried under the pulpit (which was later moved) in the Scots Church. Details in this article - SMH 6/4/1927 p.16 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16366010 . But in finding that out I came across this much more interesting story. The tower of the Scots Church was about to be demolished when it collapsed, narrowly missing the Duke of York's (later King George VI, father of The Queen) car. He was visiting the Wentworth Hotel (see photo). If he had been killed in the car, imagine how 20th century history would have changed! SMH 6/4/1927 p.17 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16365806 . Photos of the tower collapse and grave - p.20 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16365829 So early April 1927 for the date of the photo?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Your date suggestion sounds spot on to me. There is another photo - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... - of the vault dated only 2 days after those newspaper articles appeared: 8/04/1927.

comment._content:

-AG
